jobDescription: Combat Designer – Unannounced Basketball Game Location: Currently Remote About the Company: As a leading internet technology company based in China, NetEase, Inc. (NASDAQ: NTES and HKEX:9999, “NetEase”) provides premium online services centered around content creation. With extensive offerings across its expanding gaming ecosystem, the Company develops and operates some of China’s most popular and longest running mobile and PC games. Powered by industry-leading in- house R&D capabilities in China and globally, NetEase creates superior gaming experiences, inspires players and passionately delivers value for its thriving community worldwide. By infusing play with culture and education with technology, NetEase transforms gaming into a meaningful vehicle to build a more entertaining and enlightened world. Beyond games, NetEase service offerings include its majority-controlled subsidiaries Youdao (NYSE: DAO), China’s leading technology-focused intelligent learning company, and Cloud Music (HKEX: 9899), China’s leading online music content community, as well as Yanxuan, NetEase’s private label consumer lifestyle brand. NetEase’s ESG initiatives are among the best in the global media and entertainment industry, earning it a distinction as one of the S&P Global Industry Movers and an “A” rating from MSCI. For more information, please visit: http://ir.netease.com/. For more cool things we did recently, please refer to our official website: http://www.neteasegames.com/game/hot/ About the Team: This is a strategic project of NetEase IEG to expand in the global market. It is a real-time 5V5 3A basketball PC game, aiming to provide a real and competitive basketball game play experience. Our team has been deeply involved in the sports game category for many years and has rich and successful experience in online game development and operation. We keep exploring the next-generation cutting-edge technologies, in-depth research in animation, physics, AI, rendering and other technical fields, which aim to create a AAA game production pipeline and create a new era of sports games. We are passionate in what we loved, so we get together to devote for it. We look forward to your joining! Responsibilities: Responsible for the generic behavioral AI design for sports games, which meets the requirements of AI editor, with the features of visualization, adaptability, scalability, reasonable decision making, flexible configuration, etc. Design the AI system architecture for combats, collaborate with the program team and follow the whole process of developing the corresponding functions. Requirements: At least 5+ years of experience in game development, with AAA-level Single-player games or online games with 100+ million USD monthly revenue. Experience in core gameplay of AI development for Real-Time Action games, participating in the development of a large-scale mobile or PC game。 Familiarity with AI operation principle and the design of related tools. Proven experience in the design and production of behavioral AI, and the ability to plan and design the whole framework. Rich game-playing experience, familiar with the principles of basketball technique and tactics. Pluses: Good understanding of Unreal 4 and related tools is preferred. Experience in MOD production is preferred. Perks of Benefits: Competitive salary and possible bonus plan. Generous 401k company match Generous paid vacation - up to 22 days! Daily meal and commute allowance! Attractive parental leave (12 weeks at 100% pay) and family care leave. Company-paid Life Insurance Health & wellness stipend. NetEase Games is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against based on disability. Accommodation Request: We are committed to working with and providing reasonable assistance to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. If you are a disabled individual requiring an accommodation to apply for an open position, please email your request to grp.zhaopincoe@corp.netease.com. General employment questions cannot be accepted or processed here. Thank you for your interest.

Job Description - Manage the global community team of a NetEase game product. - Develop overall social media marketing, player relations and original content strategy. - Track programs budgets and oversee overall social media and original content budget. - Evaluate and lead innovation across platforms and channels, leveraging critical industry insights. - Oversee channel prioritization, PDCA, momentum plans to ensure progress toward overall program goals. - Partner with Global Brand Marketing teams to ensure brand consistency. - Maintain and optimize NetEase’s social media and original content playbook, brand voice and guidelines. - Works within strategic communications and other internal departments to ensure cohesion, create synergies and streamline processes. Job Requirements - A deep understanding of NetEase's core values and vision. - 2 or more years of PR, social, digital marketing experience in games, tech and/or entertainment industry. - 2 or more years of social media and content marketing focused program oversight. - Excellent communication and project management skills. - Good judgment in navigating and resolving sensitive situations online. - Ability to work with remote/international teams to meet joint goals. - Familiar with shooter or mmo game is preferred.

Job Description Director of Publishing and marketing is the most significant leader and founder within US, focused on the establishment and enhancement of NetEase Games’ commercial & marketing strategies and activities that result in increased users, engagement, and revenues for NetEase Games America. As a Director of Publishing, you will Establish Publishing and distribution departments for US from the ground up. Devise publishing strategies for NetEase’s US studios, including publishing timeline, distribution platform negotiation, branding strategy, and pricing strategy. Helps define go-to-market strategy and drive sign-off from leadership to ensure the marketing will be executed on schedule and on quality. Lead and continually enhance internal studio’s marketing meeting framework that best supports the go-to-market strategy and implementation across multiple game products, including Brand, Product Planning, Marketing, Product Management, Live Ops, Partnerships, Community & Competitive Gaming. Be the subject-matter expert when it comes to developer/marketing relationships process and engagement logistics. Explore user demand and develop new products for US, keep track of user needs and trends to explore new opportunities. Job Requirements Proven experience within game or digital entertainment services industry. Strong understanding of game publishing and operations within US region. A deep understanding of the International Market landscape & cultural nuances, with ability to detail key regions & game consumer groups within those markets. Exceptional organizational, analytical & reporting skills. Experience in external partner relationship management. Strong communication skills with ability to work in a multinational and diverse market. A decent team player with strong ability to cooperate and work with remote cross functional teams. Practical knowledge of Console and Mobile centric marketing tools, platforms, and channels. Passion for video games and the entertainment industry.

About NetEase Games: NetEase Games is one of the largest game developers worldwide by size and revenue. Over the years, NetEase Games has always been focusing on developing high quality contents and providing best experience for gamers all around the world. So far, the company has more than 100 games in operation. Its recent games include Naraka: Bladepoint, Knives Out, Onmyoji, Identity V, Harry Potter: Magic Awakened, etc. NetEase Games also established in-depth partnership with some of the world’s most creative studios including: Mojang (developer of Minecraft), Niantic (developer of Pokémon Go), BHVR (developer of Dead by Daylight). In the future, NetEase Games will uphold the concept of "ingenuity and innovation", together with our partners around the world, to create high-quality games that can be shared and loved by global players. About the Job: As NetEase Games is expanding rapidly in North America, Europe and Asia, we are eager to find several IT Support Specialists in the US (Seattle), Canada (Montreal) and UK (London) to provide the best technical support to the employees within the organization. Responsibilities: Provide desktop/laptop support, including but not limited to Software/Hardware issues and reinstallation of OS, and participate in information security operations. Responsible for the construction and maintenance of the network and weak current system in the office, including switch and firewall configuration and tuning. Regularly assist each studio in IT matters for onboarding/offboarding staff, including computer preparation for new employees and computer recycling after employees leave. Assist each studio with computer hardware upgrades or replacements. Responsible for the printer and conference equipment maintenance and providing conference support as requested. Communicate with studios regularly, understanding and collecting their IT requirements. Responsible for daily IT assets management and annual inventory maintenance. IT devices’ operation and maintenance, including but not limited to NAS, firewall, switch, router, AP configuration, and tuning. Daily IT issue troubleshooting with technical document writing and knowledge sharing with team members. Requirements: A Bachelor's Degree or above in computer science or other related major. At least 4 years of working experience in IT or Internet areas. Master of computer hardware installation, troubleshooting, and maintenance. Master of Windows command, strong troubleshooting skills in Windows OS. Good sense of customer service, responsibility, and execution. Strong sense of initiative, cooperation, and teamwork. Familiar with Linux scripting or Windows PowerShell and use scripting to achieve some automation in daily support Strong communication skills with customers, peers, and partners It is preferred to have experience with gaming console devkits/troubleshooting Location: Hybrid working arrangement in one of the following locations: Seattle, WA (US); Montreal, QC (Canada); London (UK).

Job Description Develop new pipeline technology for the production of current and future games. Implement efficient exporters and tools to support production teams. Maintain and support our existing pipeline technology while in use by production teams. Contribute innovative and original ideas towards all aspects of game production and development. Work with technical leader to identify technical risks and generate solutions. Work with senior team mates to complete assigned projects. Work with senior teammates to develop further skills and expertise. Keep current with the technological developments and advancements in the game industry. Analyze code for performance and optimization opportunities. Document functionality and implementation details for production and other engineers. Other duties as assigned. Supervisory Responsibilities: Directly supervises a small team. Job Requirements 5 years related experience and/or training, or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Thorough knowledge of game production tools and pipelines. Thorough knowledge of C++, and Python programming. Strong grasp of mathematical concepts and analysis techniques as they apply to game engine programming. Other Skills: Experience scheduling, scoping, and/or distributing technical work.

Location: Seattle; Los Angeles; or Remote in USA/CAN with 10% Travel Position: Full-Time Permanent The Short Story We are NetEase Games, one of the most successful video game publishers in Asia. We are expanding into the North American (NA) and European (EU) markets and need an experienced user researcher to help us generate a deep knowledge of those markets. As our Lead User Researcher and the most senior individual contributor on our NA research team, you will lead this research program and strive to generate the most valuable understanding of the NA and EU video game markets the world has ever seen. You will report directly to the Sr User Research Manager, receive support from other researchers on our team and collaborate with internal gaming experts, data scientists, and UX designers to achieve your goal. Meet your future team You will join the NA arm of NetEase Game’s Global Research Department (GRD). NetEase Games takes data and insights very seriously, and our international GRD teams with state-of-the-art research labs are proof of that. The NA team, composed of researchers of all levels of seniority, with various research expertise and varied cultural background, is the newest addition to our global workforce and is already growing fast. Our operations cover the spectrum of exploratory, generative and evaluative research projects, and the games we work on cover multiple genres across mobile, PC, and console. In addition, you will have the opportunity to collaborate and receive support from the gaming experts, data scientists, and UX designers who, together with the GRD, from the greater User Experience Center. Our ambition is to become one of the most effective and successful game user research teams in the world, and we are just getting started. What you will do Build and foster relationships across the organization, including product managers, research leads, game analysis consultants, and data scientists. Identify high-value opportunities to increase NetEase’s understanding of the NA and EU video game markets and its various player segments Secure buy-in from key stakeholders, with support from the Sr User Research Manager, by connecting research opportunities with business objectives, product roadmaps, and stakeholder priorities Define and lead complex research projects and/or programs end-to-end, with help from the rest of the research team for the execution Combine as many methods as is necessary across exploratory, generative, and evaluative research to transform opportunities into actionable data and insights Socialize and champion research insights to ensure they create significant value for NetEase Games’ players and business Coach other members of our team to help them learn new skills and grow as researchers Contribute to the efficacy and efficiency of our team by identifying and addressing the need for new or improved tools, processes, standards, learning, etc. Your biggest challenges ahead NetEase Games is expanding into the North American and European markets after having known continued success across Asia. The organization stores an immense amount of gaming knowledge and game design expertise, however, there are important cultural barriers to surmount. Gaming expectations and preferences vary greatly across these different markets that are already served by high-quality publishers. You will play the most critical role in bridging this gap. Leading long-term, multi-part, and collaborative research projects may only be half the challenge. You will also have to frame exactly how cultural differences in video game consumption should be understood and researched. This will require a great deal of independence, a large dose of perseverance, and an ability to transcend cultural barriers. Our minimum requirements Bachelor's degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science, Statistics, Psychology, Anthropology, related field, or equivalent practical experience 6 years of experience in an applied research setting, or similar Experience with a broad range of research methods (e.g., surveys, focus groups, interviews, contextual inquiries, diary studies, playtesting, etc.) Expertise with one of the above methods What will make you stand out 8+ years of user research experience in the video games industry 4+ years of experience leading complex research projects Expertise with more than one qualitative research method Strong grasp of survey design, and an understanding of more advanced survey techniques (Conjoint, Clustering, EFA, CFA, etc.) Demonstrable experience generating insights about the video game market, some of its genres, and/or some of its player segments Highly independent, including excellent goal-setting and organizational skills Knowledge of, and experience working across, the North American and Chinese cultures Strong storytelling, presentation, and data visualization skills Passionate about one or more genres of video games Some of what we offer Comprehensive health care coverage 100% 401(k)/RRSP matching up to 6%/7% of base salary (USA/CAN) Generous paid time off, holidays, and maternity/paternity leave A growth-focused environment where we care for your career NetEase Games is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against based on disability. Accommodation Request: We are committed to working with and providing reasonable assistance to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. If you are a disabled individual requiring accommodation to apply for an open position, please email your request to grp.zhaopincoe@corp.netease.com. General employment questions cannot be accepted or processed here. Thank you for your interest.

Job Description Role Overview As Lead UX Designer you will act in a project leadership capacity to solve problems that affect production’s objectives with regard to Game Experience Design. You will be responsible for building UX teams, co-dev connections and collaboration, leading the way in our AAA development initiatives. You will be reporting to the UX Director, and will closely cooperate with Producers, Artists, Designers, and Engineers across the different products while building compelling and accessible interfaces across several different games (Strategic/RPG/FPS/ACT/MMO/CAD). Job Responsibilities -Lead the NA UX design team to deliver valuable solutions for key sections such as user addition, retention, and payment and achieve excellent results; -Mentor and develop UX design professionals within the organization; provide leadership, direction and partnership for the team members; -Create and execute UX design strategies based on brand guidelines, business goals, and user needs. -Summarize and precipitate the design process, design methods, collaborate with professional UE and data team within the team to explore the design value, user value, to create top class UX design quality for the gameplayers -Collaborate closely and consistently with producers, developers and other stakeholders. Job Requirement Requirements -More than 8 years of solid and proven working experience in game UX design -Successful experience on leading, staffing, mobilizing and developing a team of UI/UX designers/artists. -User-centered mindset; Solid experience in building and improving UX systems from conception to release to ensure an optimum player experience in line with the creative direction. -Solid skills with Figma, Framer, Sketch, Adobe XD, or other design software. Knows how to create and manage a design system and design documentation. -Awareness of trends in hardware and operating systems, interface design, interactive design, and competitive software to help identify opportunities for innovation. -Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present ideas and specifications to a broad range of team members from different disciplines and understanding of how to present an idea with impact and influence. Desired Qualifications: -Experience in the AAA industry; -Familiar with the habits of gamers from North America and Western Europe, and how to leverage and improve on established conventions. About NetEase: As a leading internet technology company based in China, NetEase, Inc. (NASDAQ: NTES and HKEX:9999, “NetEase”) provides premium online services centered around content creation. With extensive offerings across its expanding gaming ecosystem, the Company develops and operates some of China’s most popular and longest running mobile and PC games. Powered by industry-leading in-house R&D capabilities in China and globally, NetEase creates superior gaming experiences, inspires players and passionately delivers value for its thriving community worldwide. By infusing play with culture and education with technology, NetEase transforms gaming into a meaningful vehicle to build a more entertaining and enlightened world. NetEase has already critically acclaimed mobile or PC games such as Knives Out, Diablo: Immortal, Harry Potter: Magic Awakened, MARVEL Super War, Onmyoji, Identity Ⅴ, Naraka: Bladepoint, etc. NetEase’s ESG initiatives are among the best in the global media and entertainment industry, earning it a distinction as one of the S&P Global Industry Movers and an “A” rating from MSCI. Benefits： Everyone in NetEase, and potential colleagues like yourself, has a voice, carves their path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Our benefits include but not limited to: - Bespoke career development plan and framework for each member - Extra commercial insurance and 401k matched by the company on top of a regular (RRSP generously offered for Canada) - Extra paid holiday leave and sufficient annual leave - Holiday gifts, lunch reimbursement and transportation allowance Ready to Join? We are waiting for your application! Apply to join our fast-growing User Experience Center and work together with our outstanding partners. You can find out more at https://hr.163.com/job-list.html . If you have any more questions, please contact us at neteasehr-ux@service.netease.com.

jobTitle: Live Ops Product Director - Diablo Immortal
jobDescription: NetEase, Inc. (NASDAQ: NTES and HKEX: 9999, “NetEase”) a global leading internet technology company based in China, provides premium online services centered around innovative and diverse content, community, communication and commerce. While NetEase Games develops and operates some of world-wide most popular mobile and PC games. NetEase partners with other leading game developers, such as Blizzard Entertainment and Mojang AB (a Microsoft subsidiary), to operate globally renowned games in China. To expand our team of the TGA mobile game of the year nominated Diablo Immortal , we are looking for a Product Leader to lead our live operation and to join our North America Team. Hybrid working opportunities, targeting all candidates station in Los Angeles or candidates willing to relocate to LA. The product director is mainly responsible for Diablo Immortal live operations within North America and the Europe market. Responsibility: 1. Coordinate with the North America operation and distribution of the project, also cooperation of various internal departments, and maintain overall operation of the project; 2. Based on the North America market and gamer habits, formulate distribution and operation strategies as well as localize the product. Including but not limited to version content planning and delivery control, in-game activity planning and user experience strategies, etc.; 3. According to the North America distribution and operation strategy of the product, guide the local operation and R&D team to innovate the product content. 4. Market analysis, estimate and monitor various operational data, make recommendations based on data analysis; 5. Cooperate with the support department to ensure a smooth connection between each platform tool and the game business, and make full use of and rationally optimize its functions based on operational needs; Job Requirement: 1. 5 years and above working experience in gaming product distribution and operations in North America. With the ability to plan and coordinate with team members of various related MMO gaming activities. 2. Passionate about the gaming industry and have a deep understanding of the major overseas mobile game markets; 3. Strong logical mindset, good communication, learning and data analysis ability. Team orientated with previous team leading experience

Job Description Reporting to the project Producer, the Product Director will act as the team lead to help build up the U.S. team and account for the project's outcome. To help take our game further in the U.S. market, the Product Director will be giving strategic guidance to tailor our game to be more accessible, approachable, and profitable in the U.S. market. At NetEase, we value diversity and support creativity and share a passion for games. What you will do: Act part of the leadership team, define and drive the game's operation and publishing strategy in the U.S. market to help build a robust product roadmap, and ensure the project's sustainability via cross-disciplinary cooperation. Develop publishing and live operations strategies and localize products based on the North America's player preference, which may include (yet does not restrict to) content optimization, game release, design, player retention strategies, etc. Effectively advocate for product vision & strategy, monitor product progression through completion of milestones, and partner with other parts of the organization. Provide valuable input into business cases based on in-depth analysis and demonstrate how that analysis impacts business metrics. Lead and manage a team of Product Managers, supporting their career development, and improving their impact through coaching and process improvements. Job Requirements We're looking for: Extensive Product Management experience in mobile game development with a proven track record in managing live operations, balancing in-game economies, and leading PM teams. Familiar with the ecosystem of Live-ops/monetization product management in the U.S. gaming market. Strong passion for games, creating fun, compelling and addictive user experiences. Ability to provide clear direction, set measurable goals, and give insight into industry trends. Collaborative problem solver, structured and organized thinker, excellent written and verbal communication. Teamwork spirit, a strong sense of responsibility, and capability to deal with stress. For more Game Planning positions, please click the below links for your reference: System Designer https://www.neteasegames.com/careers/en/20221027/31141_1049037.html Lead Product Manager https://www.neteasegames.com/careers/en/20221027/31141_1049047.html Senior Game Designer https://www.neteasegames.com/careers/en/20221027/31141_1049051.html Product Manager-Monetization https://www.neteasegames.com/careers/en/20221027/31141_1049052.html Community Designer https://www.neteasegames.com/careers/en/20221027/31141_1049056.html Player Experience Designer https://www.neteasegames.com/careers/en/20221027/31141_1049063.html

jobTitle: Product Localization 英语本地化专员
jobDescription: Company Overview NetEase Games is the online games division of NetEase, Inc. (NASDAQ: NTES; HKEX: 9999). NetEase Games is one of the largest game developers worldwide by size and revenue, which reached US$9,855.7 million in 2021. Over the years, NetEase Games has always been focused on developing high quality contents and entertaining gamers worldwide. NetEase Games also partners with other industry leaders including Blizzard Entertainment, Mojang AB (a Microsoft subsidiary) and other global game developers. For our office located in Singapore, we are in charge of game publishing mainly in Southeast Asia areas and global gaming investments. We closely work with our game development and marketing teams to publish various games from both our own game studios and external game studios. Here at NetEase Games, we offer you a creative environment for your bright ideas to come true. We are looking for talented people who are passionate about games, and eager to bring the best quality games to the world. Join us and work as a team together with integrity, collaboration and responsibility. Proficient in game localization and QA processes. (Candidates with publishing and marketing experience are preferred) 2. Professional experience in localization project management working on MOBA/FPS/TPS/SLG/Narrative-based games 3. Familiar with gaming culture. Well-informed gamer capable of offering unique insights about the gaming industry. 6. Experienced with popular mobile, console, and PC titles. 7. Excellent interpersonal and coordination skills. 8. jobTitle: Senior Gameplay Analyst - North American and European Markets
jobDescription: Job Description Establish close contact with the game development team and related stakeholders, communicate in-depth, explore research needs, and work together to create AAA game projects. Understand the R&D problems encountered by the product team and help the development team to improve the efficiency of game development. Experience the game products under development and make suggestions to optimize the game development effect. Develop a game evaluation and analysis plan, and guide the implementation team to complete the plan. Supervise the implementation effect of game evaluation and analysis plan and make final acceptance. Research the local game market and conduct a systematic analysis of competing games. Deconstruct game design and game system, design game evaluation methods needed by product teams. Complete special research on future trends in game-related subject industries and market segments. Communicate with the Chinese team, convey the analysis needs of the overseas game team, and guide and work with the Chinese team to complete the work. Job Requirements 5+ years of experience in the gaming/consulting/investment industry. Familiar with North American game development and design process, understand North American game market player preferences and understand the job responsibilities of different positions in-game companies. Enjoy working with numbers, formulas, and data analysis, and have excellent office software skills. Open-minded, strong interpersonal skills, able to build partnerships with game development, and willing to build close connections with the game development team. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a strong sense of responsibility. Fluent in English, ability to understand Chinese is a plus. Senior Technical Designer- Tool Pipeline About the Company: As a leading internet technology company based in China, NetEase, Inc. (NASDAQ: NTES and HKEX:9999, “NetEase”) provides premium online services centered around content creation. With extensive offerings across its expanding gaming ecosystem, the Company develops and operates some of China’s most popular and longest-running mobile and PC games. Powered by industry-leading in-house R&D capabilities in China and globally, NetEase creates superior gaming experiences, inspires players, and passionately delivers value for its thriving community worldwide. By infusing the play with culture and education with technology, NetEase transforms gaming into a meaningful vehicle to build a more entertaining and enlightened world. Beyond games, NetEase service offerings include its majority-controlled subsidiaries Youdao (NYSE: DAO), China’s leading technology-focused intelligent learning company, and Cloud Music (HKEX: 9899), China’s leading online music content community, as well as Yanxuan, NetEase’s private label consumer lifestyle brand. NetEase’s ESG initiatives are among the best in the global media and entertainment industry, earning it a distinction as one of the S&P Global Industry Movers and an “A” rating from MSCI. For more information, please visit http://ir.netease.com/. Role and Responsibilities: • Work with game designers, artists, programmers, and QA to design and improve the tools for game development. • With an understanding of the Art team and Design team workflow, diagnose the challenges in game development and provide solutions and implement the solutions • Keep exploring new areas and opportunities, communicate with relevant stakeholders to optimize the production process, and be responsible for the implementation. • Responsible for relevant documentation and providing guidance and training to dev teams. Qualifications: • Over 5 years of experience in game design, development, or testing. • Be familiar with all kinds of tools used in developing games. • Have professional AAA game development experience and pipeline management experience. • Be familiar with dev kit design to improve reusability and efficiency. • Be willing and proactive in guiding design-related work • Be good at internal communication, teamwork, and knowledge-sharing. • Experience in scripting and programming languages (Python, C#, Lua, C++, etc.). Plus: • Good understanding of Unreal/Unity and related tools. • Experience in using art tools such as Max and Maya. NetEase Games as an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against based on disability.

Requirements: Bachelor’s or higher degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems or related fields, or more than one year work experience of Ops, DevOps or SRE; Familiar with Linux system, understand the features and maintainance of at least one Linux distribution; Familiar with mainstream cloud serivce (e.g. AWS, GCP), understand the frequently used services and their applicable scenarios; Proficient in computer network, understand TCP, UDP protocols and other application layer protocols (e.g. HTTPS); Can code in both shell script and python, experience in other programing language is a bonus; Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; Strong ownership and self-motivated. Nice to Have: Experience in AWS, GCP operations of online/released products; Experience in MySQL, MongoDB or other database software; Experience in Kurbenetes, docker

You will have the chance to learn about everything about investment, integration, post-management, and unleash the potential for our partners around the globe. Support assessment of potential partnership and other corporate development opportunities. Assist/lead in the post management of NetEase Games’ portfolio of investments and acquisitions. Collaborate with internal finance team and legal team on deal execution. Originate deals through your growing network of founders and investors. Conduct research reports on new market trend and innovation within the broad gaming ecosystem. Familiar with interactive entertainment industry and passionate about gaming industry. Highly organized, detail oriented and proactive, self-starter attitude. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and to support multiple projects. Exceptional problem-solving, and quantitative skills, including strong financial modelling abilities. Strong interpersonal skills with ability to comfortably interact with internal team leaders and potential partners in a professional manner. Establishing and cultivating relationships with companies, corporate partners, and other relevant institutions.

Location: Redmond, WA w/ 20% travel to Los Angeles, CA Position: Full-Time Permanent The Short Story We are NetEase Games, one of the most successful video game publishers in Asia. We are expanding into the North American (NA) and European (EU) markets and need one more researcher to help us meet the high volume of research projects our expansion is creating. As the newest addition to our NA user research team, reporting to our User Research Lead, you will gain valuable hands-on experience as you help more experienced researchers execute on a variety of different research projects. Meet your future team You will join the NA arm of NetEase Game’s Global Research Department (GRD). NetEase Games takes data and insights very seriously, and our international GRD teams with state-of-the-art research labs are proof of that. The NA team, composed of researchers of all levels of seniority, with various research expertise and varied cultural background, is the newest addition to our global workforce and is already growing fast. Our operations cover the spectrum of exploratory, generative and evaluative research projects, and the games we work on cover multiple genres across mobile, PC, and console. For you, this means exposure to a wide variety of research methodologies, as well as exposure to best practices in study design, project management, and more. Our ambition is to become one of the most effective and successful game user research teams in the world, and we are just getting started. What you will do Become familiar with research objectives and protocols, and relevant product material Support with setting up and resetting research facilities (hardware and software) Gather observational data, conduct interviews, review survey data, and more Support project leads with data analysis as needed Contribute to the continued growth of our team by identifying missing documentation, inefficient processes, learning opportunities, and more Where possible and appropriate, help take on one of these growth opportunities with support from your research lead Your biggest challenges ahead NetEase Games is a big and diverse organization that moves at a fast pace. You will have a lot to learn: different game projects across different genres and platforms, different research goals and methodologies, different research environments, different project leads and stakeholders, and more. We take a structured approach to learning by documenting our practices, providing 1-on-1 coaching, and providing hands-on experience. However, the volume of requests we handle means that we also move very fast, so we will count on you to take a proactive role on your learning journey and be willing to work into the uncomfortable growth zone a good deal of the time. This role is for you if you are hungry for both challenge and growth. Our minimum requirements Bachelor's degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science, Statistics, Psychology, Anthropology, related field, or equivalent practical experience. Theoretical understanding of at least some research methods (e.g., surveys, focus groups, interviews, contextual inquiries, diary studies, playtesting, etc.). No previous professional experience is required as this is an entry-level role. What will make you stand out Good understanding of the scientific method Hands-on experience with some of the research methods above, ideally in a context where you helped improve video games or technology products Demonstrable ability to set and achieve your own learning objectives and grow through challenging assignments Passionate about one or more genres of video games Some of what we offer Comprehensive health care coverage 100% 401(k)/RRSP matching up to 6%/7% of base salary (USA/CAN) Generous paid time off, holidays, and maternity/paternity leave A growth-focused environment where we care for your career NetEase Games is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
